story.title: Running From Him - Episode 3
story.storyDescription: Avery has a secret that she’s hiding from her handsome new boss, Ethan. She doesn’t realize that Ethan has a secret of his own.
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Zoey Hughes lives in Seattle, where she enjoys writing, reading and watching bad reality TV.

story.prePaywallNotification: Why is Avery REALLY hiding out in a small town? Find out in RUNNING FROM HIM.
story.postPaywallNotification: Will Ethan figure out the REAL reason behind Avery’s sudden weakness? Keep reading RUNNING FROM HIM.

messages.text: By the end of the second work day, Avery’s hair is speckled with white putty.
The signs are gone, and the holes are filled.
You’re right, you know.
About?
You do know your way around a tool box.
Avery grins, and gives Ethan a playful push on the shoulder.
I knew I should’ve held out for twenty an hour.
I have to admit, you’d be worth every penny.
Avery blushes.
Um…so…speaking of pay…
What?
Do you think you could pay me in cash?
Why? You into tax evasion?
Avery laughs briefly and looks away.
No. Look, I know it’s weird, but I shared a bank account with my fiancé.
I left my debit card and everything behind.
I took enough cash for the trip, but not a lot extra.
I can’t cash a check because I haven’t opened a solo account yet.
I’m going to, obviously. But cash would be great.
Ethan hesitates.
Avery won’t look him in the eye.
Yeah, actually, I’m not set up for payroll yet anyway.
Really? Thanks. I appreciate it.
I’ll do a bank run tomorrow. Everything’s closed today.
Avery heaves a sigh of relief.
Well, I guess the walls are ready.
Do you wanna give me a hand moving those tables?
The electrician is coming tomorrow, and they’re in the way.
Sure.
The two work together to slide several heavy tables out of the way.
After the third one, Avery feels winded and weak — and faint with hunger.
She nearly trips before steadying herself with a hand on the table.
Whoa.
You okay?
Yeah. It’s…I’m fine.
Just got that stood-up-too-fast feeling is all.
You’re dizzy?
Only a little.
She gives him her brightest smile.
I’m good now. It passed.
You sure you’re okay?
Avery waves a dismissive hand.
Totally. Just haven’t done this much manual labor in a while.
Clearly I need to hit the gym.
Shoot, I just realized…
What?
We worked through lunch.
You probably need something to eat.
Let me cook you lunch. Make it up to you for being such a slave-driver.
Well I can’t argue with that offer.
Avery follows Ethan upstairs, into his apartment.
She grabs a stool at the little kitchen island.
She watches avidly as he puts a frying pan on the stove with some butter.
He then grabs a block of cheese and a whole loaf of French bread from the fridge.
Maybe tomorrow you should have a bigger breakfast.
I can’t have you fainting on my watch.
Ethan makes a couple of grilled cheese sandwiches.
Avery quickly devours hers.
Ethan gives her a penetrating look as she eats.
Thanks for making lunch.
I swear I always burn one side when I do grilled cheese.
No problem.
Shall we get back to work?
Four hours later, the sun has set and Ethan is sitting on a dilapidated bench behind the bar.
It was once used by smokers, judging by the litter on the ground.
He’s waiting to see where Avery goes because there is no car in the parking lot.
And the only hotel in town is five miles away.
She soon exits the building, walking away with her back to him.
Ethan waits until she crosses the street and slips into the shadows before he follows her.
Years of military service make it easy for him to trail her unnoticed.
The farther she walks, the more confused Ethan becomes.
There’s nothing down these roads but run-down houses.
She turns down a dead-end street.
Ethan stops and presses into the shadows.
He watches as Avery climbs into her car.
It’s parked in the driveway of a crumbling vacant house.
Ethan sees the dome light switches on.
Then, in the dim glow, he sees Avery pull out a sleeping bag.
With a little bit of shimmying, she gets it up over her body.
The she lowers the driver’s seat.
Jesus Christ.
He strides across the road, grabs the car door and yanks it open.
